data.title: 'Are you okay wearing...': Sanaya Irani's shocking casting couch story
data.text:
'I was like 'then I am not the fuller person...'

Detailing an unsettling experience with a representative from the South Indian film industry, she recalled, "Long ago, a person from the South wanted to meet me for a film..." "So I just went, and after the meeting, he was like 'we need a little fuller person.' And I was like 'then I am not the fuller person.'" "A lot of times, I feel that people meet girls to suss it out-is she the kind who slept or hasn't slept."

Irani revealed misleading audition experience in Bollywood

Irani also recounted a misleading audition experience related to Bollywood. She was initially informed that the audition was for a music video, only to later discover it was for a film. Irani shared, "So he was like, 'I am making this big film, there are many big heroes, and you will have to wear a bikini.' And I was like, 'And my character is?' and he was like 'Are you okay wearing a bikini?'" "He was getting rude...I hung up."
